main

Class GameView

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • city.cs.engine.WorldView
              • city.cs.engine.UserView
                • main.GameView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class GameView
extends city.cs.engine.UserView
    Provides a visual representation of a game level, including background layers, player status indicators (health bar, armor status, kill count), and victory or special condition images. Supports parallax scrolling for background layers to create depth.
    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameView

        public GameView(GameLevel gameLevel,
                int width,
                int height)
        Constructs a GameView with specified dimensions and associates it with a game level. It also loads background images based on the level name.
        Parameters:
        gameLevel - The game level this view will render.
        width - The width of the view.
        height - The height of the view.

    • Method Detail

      • loadBackgroundImages

        private void loadBackgroundImages(java.lang.String levelName)
        Loads background images based on the level name. Supports different layers for creating a parallax effect.
        Parameters:
        levelName - The name of the level, used to determine which backgrounds to load.

      • paintBackground

        protected void paintBackground(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Paints the background of the game view. Implements parallax scrolling based on the player's position to create a sense of depth.
        Overrides:
        paintBackground in class city.cs.engine.WorldView
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics2D object used for drawing.

      • drawBackground

        private void drawBackground(java.lang.String levelName,
                            java.awt.Graphics2D g)

      • paintForeground

        protected void paintForeground(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Draws the game's foreground, including the player's health bar, armor status, and kill count. Displays a victory image if the player has completed the level.
        Overrides:
        paintForeground in class city.cs.engine.WorldView
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics2D object used for drawing.
